page.title: 02Children's disco at school
page.content: At {Grayshott School}school { there are about 3{discos}every year. The discos usually cost 60 pence in advance and{cost 70 pence on the night. The{potato crisps cost{10 pence a packet}and you { can get{lollies and drinks}for{10 {pence}as well. The person who plays the records is called Dave. The disco is called{MoonBeat Disco. There are usually lots of people at the disco. There can be up to 200{ people. Dave usually gives{prizes for {the best dancers. }He gives one packet of crisps to the girls and some to{ the boys. In some of the discos he throws out{chocolate animals}about an{ inch long. These discos are organised by the PTA. The{PTA}are people who help with the school events.
